title.rendered: “Planning and Persistence: IDF Chief of Staff’s Strategy for Northern Border Security”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The Chief of Staff to the reservists in the north: the way to restore the residents on the northern border with security passes through planning and a lot of persistence.

The Chief of Staff, Lieutenant General Herzi Halevi, visited today (Wednesday) a drill of the reservist brigade “Half the Fire” (551) for readiness for the north, with the participation of the commander of the Northern Command, Major General Uri Gordin, the commander of the Ground Arm Major General Tamir Yadai, the commander of the National Ground Training Center, Brigadier General Kobi Heller, the commander of brigade 551, Colonel Ido Kas and other commanders.

Attached is a video clip of the Chief of Staff’s speech:
https://bit.ly/4bMCJtQ

Attached is a video on the subject:
https://bit.ly/4bPYwAW

Attached are pictures on the subject:
https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC22051518

Attached are the full words of the Chief of Staff: “To fight in Gaza, or in Lebanon, requires persistence. There are no easy achievements. And we need to be much more persistent than the other side, much more persistent. And we are looking but forward, and you will see, the way to restore the residents on the northern border with security also passes through a lot of skill and proper planning and a lot of persistence. You see the brigade with a lot of action, a lot of experience, a lot of achievements and also a price, which we are very aware of. But I am telling you, we are with determination, persistence, and readiness for challenges in the north, and also in actions in the south, and also in fighting terror in Judea and Samaria. And we are moving forward with this, very much relying on the people, very much relying on the reserve soldiers whose strong presence gives a lot of security also in readiness and also in professionalism. Train, lift up, we are moving forward.”
